application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Lithia Springs, GA, USA; Council Bluffs, IA, USA; The Dalles, OR 97058, USA; Lenoir, NC, USA; Moncks Corner, SC 29461, USA; New York, NY, USA; Reston, VA, USA; Pryor, OK 74361, USA; Clarksville, TN, USA
description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

As a Site Operations and Controls Lifecycle Program Manager, you'll establish influence and credibility across Google Data Centers (GDC) and provide input to key decision makers that have a direct impact on the future direction of the program. You will be accountable for developing and maintaining project charters, project plans, and other associated documentation to include appropriate Objective Key Results (OKRs). It will be important for you to consider the bigger picture while driving long-term objectives as well as near-term deliverables, and managing the impact the Data Center Operations (DCOPs) team is having on other groups within GDC.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 6 years of experience in project management.
  • 6 years of experience as a program manager or equivalent role in a critical/construction/high-tech environment, or equivalent data center technical or critical facilities/operations experience.
  • Experience working cross-functionally with stakeholders from multiple groups.
  • Ability to travel up to 20% of the time.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in product lifecycle management.
  • Experience in quantitative assessment and analysis across multiple technical disciplines.
  • Experience delivering executive briefings and summarizing technical programs and their business impact.
responsibilities:
• Identify and analyze gaps relating to SOCS in collaboration with stakeholders.
  • Develop a support and sustainability strategy to ensure support for SOCS is scalable for GDCs forecasted growth.
  • Identify resources necessary to support the support and sustainability strategy, including headcount needs and a quantifiable method to scale as the capacity of the fleet grows.
  • Develop and retain project documents to ensure appropriate stakeholders can continue to implement initiatives. Identify and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure alignment with other GDC initiatives.
  • Drive and manage strategic programs that have a direct measurable business impact on DCOPs and GDC level OKRs. Identify process breakdowns, navigate through ambiguity, define a program/process, and implement solutions.
title: Program Manager, Site Operations and Controls Lifecycle
